declarations.description: A checkbox is automatically inserted when a feature that uses it is enabled, like `<zg-column type="selector">`, or it can be manually-inserted to the grid. It can be styled via CSS.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Presence of attribute determines if the checkbox is checked

declarations.description: `<zg-colgroup>` is a container for the columns of the grid specified by `<zg-column>` tags.   This element is similar in function to the `<colgroup>` tag in an HTML element.   Developers should always add this element to their grid structure; however, ZingGrid will insert it  automatically if it is omitted.  As an non-visual element, you should not apply style to this tag. Note: Omission of `<zg-colgroup>` may result in a slight performance delay for auto-insertion.

slots.description: Colgroup content that only accepts columns (ZGColumns).

declarations.description: The `<zg-column>` tag is used to associate the columns of the grid to the values  in a dataset.  Attributes on the tag are used to configure both the data type, style, and function  of the grid column.  It is possible to build grids without explicit `<zg-column>` tags, and in that  case ZingGrid will add a column for each index in the dataset. However, developers are encouraged to  explore the features available with `<zg-column>` to utilize the powerful features ZingGrid has to offer.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: Aligns the contents of the cell

attributes.name: array-index
attributes.description: If the index is an array of objects, use array-index to indicate which index of the array object to include

attributes.name: array-slice
attributes.description: If the index is an array, you can use array-slice to indicate which array indexes to include.

attributes.name: cell-break
attributes.description: The type of `word-break` style for body cells. When not set, `cell-break` style is `normal` by default. If the width of a column is set, `cell-break` is `word` by default.

attributes.name: cell-class
attributes.description: The class to be set directly on `<zg-cell>` within the column. `cell-class` applied to `<zg-column>` will overwrite the `cell-class` applied to `<zing-grid>`.

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-action
attributes.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-delay
attributes.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the tooltip

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-icon
attributes.description: Specifies the icon to use for the cell tooltip trigger icon when using the info column type

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-position
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the cell

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-renderer
attributes.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-text
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip text for the cell of the column.  Can pass this value to renderer or template if using

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-type
attributes.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

attributes.name: content-style
attributes.description: When an additional HTML element is added to the renderer, as in the case of image and url, `content-style` will be put into a style attribute directly on the element.

attributes.name: content-width
attributes.description: Sets the width of the content inside of the cell. Used on cells of column type `element`, `iframe`, `image`, or `url`.

attributes.name: default-display
attributes.description: The data to display in each cell where the data value is null or undefined

attributes.name: details-renderer
attributes.description: Renderer for the details page of a column. To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function. The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `value of index` (for each index), `domCell`, and `cellObject`. The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the details dialog.

attributes.name: details-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's details

attributes.name: drag
attributes.description: Disables the drag state of a specific column when `column-drag` enabled on `<zing-grid>`

attributes.name: editor
attributes.description: Overrides the default editor for the column.  Can be set to a different built-in editor (based on type of column), custom editor, or `false` to turn off editor. If set to a custom editor, the attribute value should be set to the name of the object. See "Features" page on "Editing: Custom Editor Grid" for more details on custom editor.

attributes.name: editor-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's editor

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Overrides the grid level `filter` attribute.  Presence of attribute enables on `filter` column, otherwise set to `disabled` to disable.

attributes.name: filter-index
attributes.description: Sets the data field index to filter on if index itself has multiple fields.  The value set in index is the default.

attributes.name: filter-key
attributes.description: Sets the key for server side filtering.  By default the filterKey is set to the filterIndex value.

attributes.name: foot-cell
attributes.description: The aggregate function, tokenized string, or function to evaluate for the foot cell of the column. If using a function, the function takes the parameters `columnData` and `columnFieldIndex`.

attributes.name: frozen
attributes.description: Moves the column to the frozen panel specified

attributes.name: head-cell
attributes.description: The aggregate function to evaluate for the head cell of the column. If using a function, the function takes the parameters `columnData` and `columnFieldIndex`.

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: The header name for the column.   If it is not set, the default is to format the `index` value.

attributes.name: header-auto-format
attributes.description: Setting to `disabled` will turn off formatting on the header of the column.  By default, headers will convert camel, dash, or kebab case to a properly spaced and capitalized string.  Or set to a function name to customize formatting of header text.  The custom function takes in two parameters, `index` and `headerText`, and returns the formatted header text.

attributes.name: header-tooltip-action
attributes.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

attributes.name: header-tooltip-delay
attributes.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the header tooltip

attributes.name: header-tooltip-icon
attributes.description: Specifies the icon to use for the header tooltip trigger icon

attributes.name: header-tooltip-icon-position
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip icon position for the tooltip icon in the header cells

attributes.name: header-tooltip-position
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the header cell

attributes.name: header-tooltip-renderer
attributes.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

attributes.name: header-tooltip-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

attributes.name: header-tooltip-text
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip text for the header cell of the column.  Can pass this value to renderer or template if using

attributes.name: header-tooltip-trigger
attributes.description: Sets what part of the header triggers the tooltip.  If set to 'icon', an info icon is added to the header.

attributes.name: header-tooltip-type
attributes.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Presence of attribute hides the column

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: A single index or multiple indices (separated by comma), to associate information in the data source  to a column in the grid.  Nested data keys are referenced by the member character `.` (Ex. data.key).

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: Localization code used with column type `currency` and `number`

attributes.name: menu-text
attributes.description: The text to display in the control menu for the column.  If it is not set, it is set to the header text.

attributes.name: min-width
attributes.description: Sets the minimum width of the column in pixels

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description: Overrides the default renderer for the column.  Can be set to a different built-in or custom renderer. To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function. The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `value of index` (for each index), `domCell`, and `cellObject`. The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the cell.

attributes.name: renderer-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's renderer

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Indicates that the column is required to have a value on edit

attributes.name: resizable
attributes.description: Turns on column resizing for single column.  Set to `disabled` to turn off resizing on a single column.

attributes.name: resizable-max-width
attributes.description: Sets the maximum width the column can be set to when resizing

attributes.name: resizable-min-width
attributes.description: Sets the minimum width the column can be set to when resizing

attributes.name: resizablePersistent
attributes.description: Modifies the default column resizable persistence.  Set to `disabled` to turn off persistence on a single column.

attributes.name: search
attributes.description: Turns off the search on a column if `search` is present on `<zing-grid>`

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description: If multiple indices are set, this is the string that separates them in the display.  By default, it is a comma.

attributes.name: sort
attributes.description: Turns off the sort on a column if `sort` is present on `<zing-grid>`

attributes.name: sort-asc
attributes.description: Presence of attribute sorts the column data in ascending order

attributes.name: sort-desc
attributes.description: Presence of attribute sorts the column data in descending order

attributes.name: sort-intl
attributes.description: Overrides default behavior for setting special sort for international data

attributes.name: sorter
attributes.description: Overrides the default sorter for the column.  It is also possible to override the column sorting by passing in method name of sort function instead or setting to `disabled` to disable sorting.  Sorter function takes in two values (a, b) and returns 1, -1, or 0 indicating if `a > b`, `a < b`, or `a = b`. Can also be set to a path in the dataset to perform the sort on.  This is useful for sorting object indices.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the data stored in the column.  The column renderer/editor will behave based on the column type.

attributes.name: type-button-disabled
attributes.description: Presence of attribute sets the button to be in a disabled state. Can also set to "true" or "false".

attributes.name: type-button-handler
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonHander` to hook up a function call to the button click. Callback receives rowData, zg-cell DOM, and zg-cell object as arguments.

attributes.name: type-button-icon
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonIcon` to add an icon next to the rendered button in the cell

attributes.name: type-button-label
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonLabel` to add a label to the rendered button in the cell

attributes.name: type-button-url
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonURL` to add a shortcut handler on button click.  The click will automatically open the url in a new window.

attributes.name: type-checkbox-label
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `checkbox`, use `typeCheckboxLabel` to add a label next to the rendered checkbox in the cell

attributes.name: type-color-mode
attributes.description: Sets the color mode to configure the color picker. Choose between HSL, RGBA, and the default Hex.

attributes.name: type-color-preview
attributes.description: Disable the default color swatch UI preview with a false value.

attributes.name: type-currency
attributes.description: The currency to be used in currency formatting. Currency is set using using the 3 letter currency code specified by ISO 4217 specification (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

attributes.name: type-date-format
attributes.description: The tokenized formatting for a date column

attributes.name: type-date-from-now
attributes.description: Indicates if date should be displayed in FromNow format

attributes.name: type-element-attribute-name
attributes.description: Sets the attribute of the custom-element in the column when `<zg-column>` has `type` set to `element`

attributes.name: type-element-tag-name
attributes.description: Sets the tag to wrap content when `<zg-column>` has `type` set to `element`. If `type-element-attribute-name` isn't set, it will put the rendered data into the body of the element. If `type-element-attribute-name` is set, it will set the attribute to the indexed value.

attributes.name: type-iframe-ratio
attributes.description: Sets a `square` ratio instead of the default `16:9`

attributes.name: type-image-alt
attributes.description: The alternative text used with the `image` type column

attributes.name: type-image-mask
attributes.description: The alternative shape to mask the image

attributes.name: type-image-src
attributes.description: If the column type is `image`, use the `type-image-src` attribute to set the src for the image.  The src will be the index value by default.

attributes.name: type-number-decimals
attributes.description: Indicates the exact numbers to display after the decimal

attributes.name: type-number-formatting
attributes.description: Set to "disabled" to turn off default number formatting

attributes.name: type-number-max-decimals
attributes.description: Indicates the maximum numbers to display after the decimal

attributes.name: type-number-min-decimals
attributes.description: Indicates the minimum numbers to display after the decimal

attributes.name: type-radio-options
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `radio`, use `typeRadioOptions` to add rendered radio options in the cell. Can also set as array of name/value pairs where the name is displayed for the given value

attributes.name: type-range-max
attributes.description: Maximum value for the input box. Used with the `range` type column in edit mode.

attributes.name: type-range-min
attributes.description: Minimum value for the input box.  Used with `range` type column in edit mode.

attributes.name: type-range-step
attributes.description: Specifies the step between each legal value for the input box.  Used with `range` type column in edit mode.

attributes.name: type-select-default-value
attributes.description: The default value of a new record.  The select box in the create record will default to the specified value.

attributes.name: type-select-multiple
attributes.description: In edit mode, presence of attribute allows column type `select` to have multiple selections, instead of the default of a single selection

attributes.name: type-select-options
attributes.description: To set the options for the select box for a `select` column when `editor` is enabled on `<zing-grid>`. Can also set as array of name/value pairs where the name is displayed for the given value

attributes.name: type-toggle-options
attributes.description: When the column type is set to `toggle`, use `typeToggleOptions` to set the list of options for the display.

attributes.name: type-toggle-render-value
attributes.description: When the column type is set, the render and value will be the same.  This prevents the default creating of true/false for toggles.

attributes.name: type-url-icon
attributes.description: If the column type is `url`, use this attribute to reference any `<zg-icon>` within the library to replace the link text with this icon.

attributes.name: type-url-src
attributes.description: If the column type is `url`, use the `type-url-src` attribute to set the src for the link.  The link will be the index value by default.

attributes.name: type-url-text
attributes.description: If the column type is `url`, use the `type-url-text` attribute to set the text displayed for the link.

attributes.name: validation-error-message
attributes.description: Sets the validation error message for the column.  Overrides any other settings.

attributes.name: validation-required-message
attributes.description: Sets the validation required message for the column.  Overrides any other settings.

attributes.name: validator
attributes.description: Sets the validation method for the column.  Overrides the default for the column type

attributes.name: visibility-priority
attributes.description: Used in the case of automatically removing columns on resize.  Columns without a `visibility-priority` never gets removed. The rest of the columns are removed from highest `visibility-priority` value to the lowest.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Sets the width of the column.

declarations.description: The `<zg-control-bar>` is inserted dynamically by the ZingGrid library and serves as a container for the grid's interface controls.  As a generated element, developers should not manually place `<zg-control-bar>` in their grid; however, they may style the bar and its internal elements using CSS.

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-border-bottom
cssProperties.description: Styles the bottom border of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-background
cssProperties.description: Styles the background of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-border-top
cssProperties.description: Styles the top border of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-margin
cssProperties.description: Sets the margin of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-min-height
cssProperties.description: Sets the min-height of control bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-visibility
cssProperties.description: Sets the visibility of component

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-padding
cssProperties.description: Sets the padding of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-layout-justify-content
cssProperties.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of contents in inner layout container

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-layout-content
cssProperties.description: Sets the before 'content' of inner layout container

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-border-left
cssProperties.description: Styles the left border of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-border
cssProperties.description: Styles the border of control-bar

cssProperties.name: --zg-control-bar-border-right
cssProperties.description: Styles the right border of control-bar

declarations.description: The `<zg-data>` tag is used to associate a dataset with the actual grid.   A top-level attribute is placed on `<zing-grid>` for basic cases, but when more fine grain  control is required, `<zg-data>`should be employed and various configuration values set via the  `options` attribute, or more appropriately via `<zg-param>` tags nested within the tag.

attributes.name: adapter
attributes.description: Adapter is a shortcut to set known options for specific third party datasets.  Currently supports `graphql` and  `firebase`. Developers could register their own custom adapters.  For more information on custom adapters, visit Guides > ZingGrid Object > registerAdapter().

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: Data for the grid presented as an array or object.  If set as an attribute value, the data needs to be in JSON format.

attributes.name: id-key
attributes.description: In the case of non-key based objects, the idKey can be set to indicate the id to send back to the datasource on CRUD commands. For example, if the READ URL was https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/ then the UPDATE would be https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/VALUE_OF_IDKEY.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: Used to set `<zg-param>`, the configuration data for `<zg-data>`.  This should never be used directly as an attribute and is meant for object instantiation and for setting in JavaScript.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Specifies the absolute or relative URL to fetch data from to populate the grid

slots.description: Data content that only accepts data configuration options (ZGParams).

declarations.description: The `<zg-dialog>` tag is used internally for dialogs used by  CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) actions, as well as to allow for custom dialogs to be created for generic use with the grid.  The design goal of the custom element is to extend HTML's `<dialog>` element for a consistent style and more data grid- related duties.

attributes.name: cancel
attributes.description: Callback method to call on custom dialog when the dialog's "cancel" button is clicked

attributes.name: confirm
attributes.description: Callback method to call on custom dialog when the dialog's "confirm" button is clicked

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Sets the dialog's header 'label' text

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: The presence of the specification-standard `open` attribute designates whether the dialog is shown or hidden

cssParts.name: form
cssParts.description: Dialog form consisting of header, body, and footer.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: Dialog header consisting of header label and close button.

cssParts.name: body-error
cssParts.description: Dialog error message that appears top of dialog body.

cssParts.name: body-content-wrapper
cssParts.description: Dialog content wrapper that wraps around editor labels and inputs.

cssParts.name: footer
cssParts.description: Dialog footer consisting of footer buttons (cancel and confirm).

declarations.description: The `<zg-focus>` element is a generated element added to `<zing-grid>` when the `selector` attribute is defined. declarations.description: The `<zg-foot>` tag contains the foot cells (`<zg-foot-cell>`) of the data  grid specified via the `foot-cell` attribute found on `<zg-column>` tags.  The tag roughly corresponds to the idea of the `<tfoot>` tag used in HTML tables.  The `<zg-foot>` tag is  generated by the library and should not be placed in a grid manually by a developer, but instead is used as a styling target for CSS.

declarations.description: The `<zg-footer>` cell is a simple container element for content placed at the bottom of a grid.   It may contain `<zg-caption>` or `<zg-source>`, but also may contain arbitrarily defined elements inserted by the  developer.  The element and its contents are stylable directly using CSS.

The `<zg-head>` tag contains the head cells (`<zg-head-cell>`) of the data grid specified via the `head-cell` attribute found on `<zg-column>` tags. declarations.description: `<zg-icon>` is used to display custom ZingGrid icons within the grid.   The icon is set by its name, but can have a different look based on the grid's theme.   `<zg-icon>` is created internally when a feature that uses it is enabled, like `pager`,  but can be included in the grid manually as long as the name attribute exists.

attributes.description: Sets the icon type of `<zg-icon>`

cssProperties.description: Sets the height of icon. Also set width using --zg-icon-width to scale icon.

cssProperties.description: Sets fill color of icon when element has [init] attribute. This indicates that column is sortable. The [init] is removed when column is sorted.

cssProperties.description: Sets the width of icon. Also set height using --zg-icon-height to scale icon.

cssProperties.name: --zg-icon-color
cssProperties.description: Sets the fill color of icon

declarations.description: Allows you to switch between normal row mode and condensed card mode for the grid.   `<zg-layout-controls>` is created internally and should not be placed directly in the user's HTML; however, the user can style the `<zg-layout-controls>` using the `zg-layout-controls` selector.

The `<zg-load-mask>` element is used to define the loading overlay that displays on top of the grid before the grid is completely rendered.  The element is generally dynamically created,  though it is possible to manually define it for a complex loading screen. Define a simple message and use CSS to style the element.

declarations.description: The `<zg-menu>` element is a container for a custom menu for ZingGrid  used as a context or static (aka "Hamburger") menu.  The element is generally dynamically  inserted by the library, though the developer can append of overwrite menu with custom  entries.  The element can be styled using CSS.

attributes.description: Presence of attribute replaces the default context menu with a custom menu. If `replace` is not set, the custom menu will be appended to the end of the default menu.

declarations.description: `<zg-param>` is a non-visual element used to pass the configuration options for the `<zg-data>`  element more cleanly via `name`-`value` pairs.  The element is not required, though it is preferred, as everything set  within a `<zg-param>` element can also be set directly on `<zg-data>` via the `config` attribute.  Developers should note  that when setting complex values for the `value` attribute to use JSON encoded values.  Also, as a non-visual element,  CSS styling does not apply to `<zg-param>`.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of parameter

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value for given data key.  If the value is an object, format as JSON encoded version of string.

declarations.description: `<zg-row>` is the container for the `<zg-cell>`, `<zg-head-cell>`, and `<zg-filter>` elements. It corresponds to the `<tr>` tag on an HTML table. The `<zg-row>` element is created dynamically and should not be placed in the grid by a developer.   However, the element is useful for styling the various rows of the grid using CSS.

declarations.description: `<zg-tooltip>` elements are inserted dynamically by the ZingGrid library and serves as a container for the grid's tooltips.  As a generated element, developers should not manually place `<zg-tooltip>` in their grid; however, they may style the tooltips and its internal elements using CSS.

The most important tag in the library. Contains most of the attributes to turn grid features on/off.  Set `zing-grid:not(:defined) {display:none;}` to hide <zing-grid> instances until they are ready.  This stops child elements from appearing unstyled for a brief moment.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: Aligns the contents of all column cells (center|left|right)

attributes.name: button-tooltip-disabled
attributes.description: Turns off the tooltips on all buttons in the grid

attributes.name: caption
attributes.description: The caption for the grid

attributes.name: card
attributes.description: Specifies the defined `<zg-card>` of the grid.  More appropriate to use `<zg-card>` in most cases or set the property programmatically.

attributes.name: cell-break
attributes.description: The type of `word-break` style for body cells. When not set, `cell-break` style is `normal` by default. If the width of a column is set, `cell-break` is `word` by default. To overwrite `cell-break` for cells in a specific column, set `cell-break` for that column.

attributes.name: cell-class
attributes.description: Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the grid. This attribute can be applied to both `<zing-grid>` or `<zg-column>`. If the attribute is applied to both, `<zg-column>`'s `cell-class` overwrites `<zing-grid>`'s `cell-class`. To set a class conditionally, set `cell-class` to the name of the function, which takes in the arguments: `cellData`, `domContainer`, `cellObject`.

attributes.name: cell-editor
attributes.description: Turns cell editing on or off. Automatically turned on when setting `editor` or `editor-controls`.

attributes.name: cell-focus
attributes.description: Turns off keyboard nav cell focus if set to disabled

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-action
attributes.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-delay
attributes.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the tooltip. If delay is not specified, it is 1000ms on cell tooltips without an icon and 0ms on cell tooltips with an icon.

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-icon
attributes.description: Specifies the icon to use for the info column types

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-position
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the cell

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-renderer
attributes.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

attributes.name: cell-tooltip-type
attributes.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

attributes.name: col-class
attributes.description: Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in targeted `<zg-column>`. To apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`, and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

attributes.name: column-drag
attributes.description: Enables column dragging

attributes.name: column-drag-action
attributes.description: Specifies the action of dragging allowed.  By default, if `column-drag` is enabled then `column-drag-action` is set `"both"`.  This property will turn on column-drag if not already set.

attributes.name: column-resizable
attributes.description: Presence of attribute turns on column resizing for all columns. This excludes internal column types (), which requires setting ZGColumn[resizable] on the column.

attributes.name: column-resizable-max-width
attributes.description: Sets the maximum width columns can be set to when resizing

attributes.name: column-resizable-min-width
attributes.description: Sets the minimum width columns can be set to when resizing

attributes.name: column-resizable-persistent
attributes.description: Presence of attribute displays column resizing for all columns without hover

attributes.name: column-width
attributes.description: Sets the width each of the columns

attributes.name: columns
attributes.description: Specifies the columns of the grid.  More appropriate to use `<zg-column>` in most cases or set the property programmatically.

attributes.name: columns-control
attributes.description: Presence of attribute turns on the menu to show and hide columns

attributes.name: compact
attributes.description: Augments internal themes to a compact mode

attributes.name: config
attributes.description: Used to set multiple grid properties at once.  This should never be used directly. This is meant for object instantiation.

attributes.name: confirm-delete
attributes.description: Turns off delete confirmation if set to disable

attributes.name: context-menu
attributes.description: Enables the default `<zing-grid>` context menu or set to the id name of a custom `<zg-menu>`.  If set to a custom menu and `<zg-menu>` has the `replace` attribute present, then the custom menu will replace the context menu. Otherwise the contents of the custom menu is appended to the end of context menu.

attributes.name: creator
attributes.description: Sets the create editor to modal (default) or inline.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: Data for the grid presented as an array or object

attributes.name: default-display
attributes.description: The data to display in each cell where the data value is null or undefined

attributes.name: dialog
attributes.description: Sets `<zg-dialog>` to display dialog and mask within the grid dimensions instead of the whole screen

attributes.name: dir
attributes.description: The HTML standard direction to indicate direction of grid's columns and text

attributes.name: editor
attributes.description: Turns on the grid editor.  Enables single cell editing via double click. Sets the editor to inline (default) or modal.

attributes.name: editor-controls
attributes.description: Adds columns for the editor controls.  If it is added, default is "all".

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Enables filtering for all columns.  Can be turned on/off individually via column.

attributes.name: foot-class
attributes.description: Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the `<zg-foot>`. To apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run  on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`, and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

attributes.name: frozen-columns-left
attributes.description: Sets the number of columns to freeze to the left

attributes.name: frozen-columns-right
attributes.description: Sets the number of columns to freeze to the right

attributes.name: frozen-row-class
attributes.description: Adds a class to each `<zg-row>` element. To apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `data`, `rowIndex` (1-based),  `domRow`, and `rowObject`, `rowParent`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

attributes.name: frozen-rows-bottom
attributes.description: Sets the number of rows to freeze to the bottom

attributes.name: frozen-rows-top
attributes.description: Sets the number of rows to freeze to the top

attributes.name: gridlines
attributes.description: Sets vertical, horizontal or both grid lines to the grid

attributes.name: head-class
attributes.description: Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the `<zg-head>`. To apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run  on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`, and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

attributes.name: header-auto-format
attributes.description: Converts camel, dash, and kebab case to properly spaced and capitalized typography. Setting to `disabled` will turn off formatting on headers.  Set to a function name to customize formatting of headers.

attributes.name: header-tooltip-action
attributes.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

attributes.name: header-tooltip-delay
attributes.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the header tooltip

attributes.name: header-tooltip-icon
attributes.description: Specifies the icon to use for the header tooltip trigger icon

attributes.name: header-tooltip-icon-position
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip icon position for the tooltip icon in the header cells

attributes.name: header-tooltip-position
attributes.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the header cell

attributes.name: header-tooltip-renderer
attributes.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content

attributes.name: header-tooltip-template
attributes.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display

attributes.name: header-tooltip-trigger
attributes.description: Sets what part of the header triggers the tooltip.  If set to 'icon', an info icon is added to the header.

attributes.name: header-tooltip-type
attributes.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Sets the height of the grid.  If the height is less than the size of the content, scrolling is added to grid body.

attributes.name: icon-set
attributes.description: Allows the user to change the grid icon set to an allowed 3rd-party type (e.g., Font-Awesome). To use a custom icon set, the icon set must first be registered.

attributes.name: icon-set-data
attributes.description: If setting [icon-set="custom"], points to the custom JSON key/value mapping

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description: Sets the language to use for the grid

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Sets the grid layout to be either `card` or `row` and adds `<zg-layout-controls>` to the grid. The default is based on the size of the user's screen, unless `layout` is set.

attributes.name: layout-controls
attributes.description: When `layout` is set, by default `layout-controls` is enabled. To hide, set `layout-controls` to `disabled`.  Presence of this attribute will enable `<zg-layout-controls>` even if `layout` is not set.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Presence of attribute adds loading state to grid, which triggers `<zg-load-mask>` to show. This attribute allows styling the height of the grid (via CSS) before the data has loaded in the grid.

attributes.name: loading-text
attributes.description: Sets the text to display in the `<zg-load-mask>` on data load

attributes.name: loadmask
attributes.description: Set `loadmask="disabled"` to prevent the `<zg-load-mask>` from showing on data load.

attributes.name: nested-data-separator
attributes.description: Indicates separator that should be used for nested headers and data paths.  By default, the '.' is used: 'fullName.first' Setting to `disabled` will turn off parsing for nested headers and will not look at pathing for data

attributes.name: no-data
attributes.description: Sets the message that appears in the `<zg-no-data>` element when there are no records

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: Sets the number of records or rows to display per page. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

attributes.name: page-size-card
attributes.description: Sets the number of cards to display per page when in card mode. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

attributes.name: page-size-options
attributes.description: Sets the options for page size in `zg-option-list`. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

attributes.name: page-size-row
attributes.description: Sets the number of rows to display per page when in row mode. Can be set only if `pager` is set.

attributes.name: pager
attributes.description: Adds pagination functionality and controls to the grid

attributes.name: pager-button-limit
attributes.description: Determines max number of page buttons to display.  Default is 5.

attributes.name: pager-position
attributes.description: Sets pager position. Note: `pager` attribute or `<zg-pager>` must be present in order to position pager.

attributes.name: pager-type
attributes.description: Determines which type of pagination to use, input or buttons

attributes.name: params
attributes.description: Name/Value pairs of `<zg-param>` values.  More appropriate to use `<zg-param>` in most cases.

attributes.name: preserve-state-id
attributes.description: The ID to use as the key in storing the state.  Each grid should have a unique ID or else the state data  will be shared across grids.

attributes.name: preserve-state-load
attributes.description: The method to call when state is ready to be retrieved.  Must also set preserveStateSave and preserveStateId

attributes.name: preserve-state-options
attributes.description: Comma separated list of features to save in state preservation.   Options are 'columnfrozen', 'columnposition', 'columnvisibility', 'columnwidth', 'filter', 'layout', 'page', 'pagesize', 'rowfrozen', 'rowselector', 'search', 'selector', 'sort' NOTE:  If columnfrozen is set, then columnposition will implicitly be set as well

attributes.name: preserve-state-save
attributes.description: The method to call when state is ready to be saved.  Must also set preserveStateLoad and preserveStateId.

attributes.name: record-count
attributes.description: Sets the total record count.  Useful for `loadByPage` when the response packet does not return total count of records.

attributes.name: record-duplicate
attributes.description: Adds the duplicate control to the end of the row before the edit controls

attributes.name: record-key
attributes.description: Adds the record key column to the grid.  If set to a string, the string is the header text.

attributes.name: row-class
attributes.description: Adds a class to each `<zg-row>` element. To apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `data`, `rowIndex` (1-based),  `domRow`, and `rowObject`, `rowParent`, `bodyRowIndex` (1 based), and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

attributes.name: row-height
attributes.description: Sets the height of each body row.  By default, the body row height is set to 'auto' where it will auto fit the content. In the case of frozen columns, the default body row height is '48px' because there is a performance hit when using 'auto' with frozen columns.

attributes.name: row-selector
attributes.description: Adds `selector` type column to the rows as the first column

attributes.name: search
attributes.description: Turns on the search feature and adds `<zg-search>` to the grid. The search button appears in the caption header.

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description: Turns on the selector feature on the grid and adds `<zg-selector-mask>` to the grid

attributes.name: server-rendered
attributes.description: Indicates that the grid was completely rendered on the server and embedded in the page

attributes.name: sort
attributes.description: Enables sorting on all columns.  It is possible to disable specific columns via the column's object or setting `sort="disabled"` to specified columns.

attributes.name: sort-intl
attributes.description: Overrides default behavior for international sorting.  Turn off international sorting with `sort-intl="disabled"`.

attributes.name: sorter
attributes.description: Override the column sorting by passing in method name of sort function instead.  Sorter function takes in two values (a, b) and returns 1, -1, or 0 indicating if `a > b`, `a < b`, or `a = b`.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Defines the source of the data in the grid. Adds the `<zg-source>` element.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Specifies the absolute or relative URL to fetch data from to populate the grid

attributes.name: static-menu
attributes.description: Adds a display button that launches the contextmenu.  If set to a custom menu and `<zg-menu>` has the `replace` attribute present, then the custom menu will replace the context menu. Otherwise the contents of the custom menu is appended to the end of context menu.

attributes.name: status-delay
attributes.description: Changes the duration a status message will remain visible until it automatically closes (in milliseconds)

attributes.name: status-persist
attributes.description: Prevents status messages from automatically closing after a delay

attributes.name: status-position
attributes.description: Positions the status message in one of nine positions relative to the grid
attributes.type: 'top left' | 'center left' | 'bottom left' | 'top center' | 'center' | 'bottom center' | 'top right' | 'center right' | 'bottom right' | 'bar'

attributes.name: template-end-delimiter
attributes.description: Defines the regex expression for closing data binding

attributes.name: template-start-delimiter
attributes.description: Defines the regex expression for starting data binding

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: Sets the theme of the grid.  Built-in themes are specified by keyword, but custom theme names are also accepted by setting a URL path to your custom css theme file.  For custom themes, on load set `theme` to the path to the custom theme file.  After, set to theme name to switch themes.

attributes.name: validation-error-message
attributes.description: Sets the default validation error message

attributes.name: validation-required-message
attributes.description: Sets the default validation required message

attributes.name: viewport
attributes.description: Internal attribute.  Should not be set.

attributes.name: viewport-pause
attributes.description: Keeps current value of `viewport` and freezes the breakpoint

attributes.name: viewport-stop
attributes.description: Removes `viewport` attribute, disabling viewport resizing

attributes.name: viewport-types
attributes.description: Sets custom `viewport` breakpoints (value string-object must be valid JSON). NOTE: If you don't set `mobile`, the grid won't auto-set card or row mode.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Sets the width of the grid.  If the width is less than the size of the content, scroll is added to `<zg-body>`.

attributes.name: zebra
attributes.description: Presence of attribute adds the classes, `zebra-1` and `zebra-2`, alternating on `<zg-row>` elements.  Setting to a list of class names will assign classes in sequential order.  For conditional zebra classes, `zebra` also accepts name of function that returns a class name to use for zebra striping.

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-body-border-top
cssProperties.description: Styles the top border of grid body

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-border-top
cssProperties.description: Styles the top border of grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-box-shadow
cssProperties.description: Applies a box shadow behind grid

cssProperties.description: The font color of grid

cssProperties.description: Sets the font family of grid text

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-border-right
cssProperties.description: Styles the right border of grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-font-style
cssProperties.description: Sets the font style of grid text

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-font-weight
cssProperties.description: Sets the font weight of grid text

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-table-border
cssProperties.description: Styles the border of grid table contents

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-table-border-bottom
cssProperties.description: Styles the bottom border of grid table contents

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-table-border-left
cssProperties.description: Styles the left border of grid table contents

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-border-radius
cssProperties.description: Applies border radious to grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-body-border-right
cssProperties.description: Styles the right border of grid body

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-border-left
cssProperties.description: Styles the left border of grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-body-border-left
cssProperties.description: Styles the left border of grid body

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-border-bottom
cssProperties.description: Styles the bottom border of grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-body-border-bottom
cssProperties.description: Styles the bottom border of grid body

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-border
cssProperties.description: Styles the border of grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-body-border
cssProperties.description: Styles the border of grid body

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-background
cssProperties.description: Styles the background of grid

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-table-border-top
cssProperties.description: Styles the top border of grid table contents

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-freeze-style-border
cssProperties.description: Styles the border of the frozen column styling element

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-table-border-right
cssProperties.description: Styles the right border of grid table contents

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-font-size
cssProperties.description: Sets the font size of grid text

cssProperties.name: --zing-grid-freeze-style-box-shadow
cssProperties.description: Styles the box-shadow of the frozen column styling element

events.name: card:click
events.description: Fires the `card:click` and `record:click` event when a click occurs on a record (card).

events.name: card:mouseout
events.description: Fires the event when mouse is moved out a record (card).

events.name: card:mouseover
events.description: Fires the event when mouse is moved over a record (card).

events.name: cell:beforerender
events.description: Fires the event before a cell is rendered.

events.name: cell:click
events.description: Fires the event when a click occurs to a cell.

events.name: cell:closeedit
events.description: Fires the event when the cell editor is closed.

events.name: cell:copy
events.description: Fires the event when copying (ctrl+c) occurs in a cell.

events.name: cell:mouseout
events.description: Fires the event when mouse is moved out of a cell.

events.name: cell:mouseover
events.description: Fires the event when mouse is moved over a cell.

events.name: cell:openedit
events.description: Fires the event when the cell editor is opened.

events.name: cell:paste
events.description: Fires the event when pasting (ctrl+p) occurs in a cell.

events.name: cell:rightclick
events.description: Fires the event when right click occurs on a cell.

events.name: column:click
events.description: Fires event when click on a column.

events.name: column:filter
events.description: Fires the event when a column is filtered.

events.name: column:mouseout
events.description: Fires event when mouseout on a column.

events.name: column:mouseover
events.description: Fires event when mouseover on a column.

events.name: data:cell:beforechange
events.description: Fires the event before a single cell value is changed.

events.name: data:cell:change
events.description: Fires the event after a single cell value is changed.

events.name: data:load
events.description: Fires the event every time a new dataset is loaded in the grid.

events.name: data:record:beforechange
events.description: Fires the event before a record (row) is changed.

events.name: data:record:beforedelete
events.description: Fires the event before a record (row) is deleted from the grid.

events.name: data:record:beforeinsert
events.description: Fires the event before a new record (row) is added to the grid.

events.name: data:record:change
events.description: Fires the event after a record (row) is changed.

events.name: data:record:delete
events.description: Fires the event when a record (row) is deleted from the grid.

events.name: data:record:insert
events.description: Fires the event after a new record (row) is added to the grid.

events.name: data:record:openinsert
events.description: Fires event when the insert dialog is opened

events.name: grid:beforerender
events.description: Fires the event once before the grid renders.

events.name: grid:columnmove
events.description: Fires the event when a column is moved to a frozen spot or within a fram

events.name: grid:columntogglevisiblity
events.description: Fires the event when a column is hidden or shown

events.name: grid:contextmenuclose
events.description: Fires the  event when the contextmenu is closed.

events.name: grid:contextmenuopen
events.description: Fires the event when the contextmenu is opened.

events.name: grid:deselect
events.description: Fires the event when selection is deselected in the grid.

events.name: grid:hydrate
events.description: Fires the event when the pre-rendered grid is finished being hydrated.

events.name: grid:keydownesc
events.description: Fires the event when the (Esc) key is pressed.

events.name: grid:pagechange
events.description: Fires the event when a page changes in the grid.

events.name: grid:pagefirst
events.description: Fires the event when the grid changes to the first page.

events.name: grid:pagelast
events.description: Fires the event when the grid changes to the last page.

events.name: grid:pagenext
events.description: Fires the event when the grid changes to the next page.

events.name: grid:pageprev
events.description: Fires the event when the grid changes to the previous page.

events.name: grid:pagesizechange
events.description: Fires the event when the `page-size` (amount of rows displaying) changes on the grid.

events.name: grid:ready
events.description: Fires the grid ready event when grid is ready.

events.name: grid:refresh
events.description: Fires the event when the grid is refreshed through grid controls or API method `refresh()`.

events.name: grid:render
events.description: Fires the event once when grid renders.

events.name: grid:scroll
events.description: Fires the event when scrolling occurs in grid.

events.name: grid:search
events.description: Fires the event when a the grid is searched.

events.name: grid:select
events.description: Fires the event when selection is made in the grid.

events.name: grid:selectall
events.description: Fires the event when selecting every cell (ctrl+a) in the grid.

events.name: grid:sort
events.description: Fires the event when a the grid is sorted

events.name: header:click
events.description: Fires event when click on a header cell.

events.name: menu-item:click
events.description: Fires the event when custom menu item is clicked.

events.name: record:click
events.description: Fires the `row:click` and `record:click` event when a click occurs on a record (row).

events.name: record:mouseout
events.description: Fires when the mouse cursor leaves the record (row).

events.name: record:mouseover
events.description: Fires when the mouse cursor enter the record (row).

events.name: row:click
events.description: Fires the `row:click` and `record:click` event when a click occurs on a record (row).

events.name: row:frozen
events.description: Fires when the frozen row state changes

events.name: row:mouseout
events.description: Fires the event when mouse is moved out a record (row).

events.name: row:mouseover
events.description: Fires the event when mouse is moved over a record (row).

events.name: row:select
events.description: Fires when the row selector changes

members.name: customizeDialog
members.description: Customizes the user's dialog

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of dialog to customize. If you set as null, the config will be applied to all dialogs. Options are:
  • record-create
  • record-delete
  • record-info
  • record-update
  • view-error
  • view-info
  • view-success
  • view-warn
  • zg-version

parameters.name: config
parameters.description:
Options for the data retrieval. Options are:
  • cancel: Text for the Cancel Button
  • confirm: Text for the Confirm Button
  • title: The Title to display on the Dialog

return.description: Returns the component so that you can chain methods together

members.name: getData
members.description: Fetches the internal property referencing the dataset for the grid

parameters.name: config
parameters.description:
Optional, options for the data retrieval. Options are:
  • csv: Boolean indicating if it should be sent as a csv string. Default is false.
  • headers: Boolean indicating if headers should be included. Default is false. Only applies to csv or JSON array of arrays as JSON objects have a key already.
  • cols: String indicating if we should return all columns or only visible. 'all' or 'visible' are options.
  • rows: String indicating if we should return all rows or only filtered/searched. 'all' or 'visible' are options.

return.description: The dataset.

members.name: customizeDialog
members.description: Customizes the user's dialog for all instances of ZingGrid

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of dialog to customize. If you set as null, the config will be applied to all dialogs. Options are:
  • record-create
  • record-delete
  • record-info
  • record-update
  • view-error
  • view-info
  • view-success
  • view-warn
  • zg-version

parameters.name: config
parameters.description:
Options for the data retrieval. Options are:
  • cancel: Text for the Cancel Button
  • confirm: Text for the Confirm Button
  • label: Label to display on the Dialog

return.description: Returns the component so that you can chain methods together

members.name: registerAdapter
members.description: Register a method to make connecting a remote data src to your grid even easier. If you have your own standardized endpoints this is very useful. A way for us to provide an ES6 style import  mechanism and pattern for building custom data sources.

parameters.name: sType
parameters.description: The string name for the adapter

parameters.name: oOptions
parameters.description: Option list of of adapter variables you want to define. You can define ANY zg-param name value pair here in this option. Refer to the Store.js variable this.oDefaultDataFormat

members.name: registerCellType
members.description: Register a custom column type to reduce redundant markup and re-use similar code.

parameters.name: sType
parameters.description: Name of cell type.

parameters.name: oOptions
parameters.description: An object to define the renderer and/or editor for the cell type.

members.name: registerEditor
members.description: Register the life cycle hooks for cell editing. This allows you to import and inherit editors for your library.

parameters.name: sCellType
parameters.description: Cell type editor to override

parameters.name: oConfig
parameters.description: Object containing editor hooks

members.name: registerMethod
members.description: Register a method to make it available to ZingGrid even if it outside the window scope. This can be used to make a method accessible to renderer, editor, sorter, and custom styles This is useful for methods within a class or local methods.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The method that you wish to expose to ZingGrid.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name to refer to the method.  If the method is not anonymous, the name will default to the name of the method.  If it is anonymous, a name must be set.  Whatever is set here is how you should refer to the method in the grid. Optional.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the method.  When the method is called `this` will be set to the `scope` value. Optional.

members.name: registerNamespace
members.description: Register a namespace to make it available to ZingGrid even if it outside the window scope. Once a namespace is registered, the methods within the namespace will be accessible to ZingGrid without having to call `ZingGrid.registerMethod`

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace that you wish to expose to ZingGrid.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name to refer to the namespace. Optional.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the namespace.  When a method within the namespace is called, `this` will be set to the `scope` value. Defaults to the namespace itself. Optional.

members.name: registerValidator
members.description: Register the life cycle hooks for cell validation. This allows you to import and inherit validators for your library.

parameters.name: oValidator
parameters.description: The validator that you wish to expose to ZingGrid.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name to refer to the validator. Optional.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the method.  When the method is called `this` will be set to the `scope` value. Optional.

members.name: searchIsTable
members.description: Searches for table element(s) with the `[is="zing-grid"]` attribute to insert the zing-grid. This method should only be used when `table[is="zing-grid"]` is added after the Document has been loaded.
